5a353979-a110-4855-8191-6a028bd2ceb7.description: The course objective is to provide the law enforcement student with the knowledge and skills necessary to perform effectively as an entry-level State Police Trooper. This course is recommended for a total of 30 SH in the lower-division baccalaureate/associate degree category
5a353979-a110-4855-8191-6a028bd2ceb7.name: Entry-Level Law Enforcement Training(v.6)

issuer.summary: issued by Virginia State Police Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, presentations, performance-based testing, and practical exercises with a minimum passing score of 75 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, computer-based training, discussion, laboratory, learner presentations, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include professionalism; physical training; legal issues; field training; crime investigation (basic and intermediate) enforcement strategies; defensive tactics; traffic crash investigation; and driver training.

31dfa3e9-7e5a-4624-ada6-e57c034bfcc5.description: The course objective is to build upon the foundation of crash investigation knowledge gained in prerequisite courses to provide a further understanding of crash investigation and reconstruction techniques. Topics such as kinetic energy, impulse, and Delta V are expanded upon and the topics of conservation of momentum, time/distance, and airborne calculations are studied in more depth than in previous courses. In addition, the student will be introduced to pedestrian crash investigation.
31dfa3e9-7e5a-4624-ada6-e57c034bfcc5.name: At-Scene Advanced Crash Investigation (Level I)(v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Virginia State Police Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, performance-based testing, and practical exercises with a minimum passing score of 75 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include review of basic of crash investigation; general airborne equations; pedestrian crash investigation conservation of momentum both vector and algebraic solutions; time and distance equations and analysis.

6ced89fa-36bc-4c33-96de-d45092d4bd9c.description: The course objective is to provide the student with the minimum requirements needed to become a state certified Criminal Justice Instructor and to afford information and instructional methodologies that specifically pertain to this agency.
6ced89fa-36bc-4c33-96de-d45092d4bd9c.name: General Instructor Development Course(v.5)

issuer.summary: issued by Virginia State Police Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, written papers, performance-based testing, and practical exercises with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, learner presentations, lecture, and practical exercises.

1187f721-8b15-4e49-9994-a5bf55d87979.description: The course objective is to build upon the basics of Advanced Crash Investigation, At Scene (Level I). The student will receive advanced training in theory and derivation of reconstruction equations; flip and vault speed calculations; fall speed calculations, time, distance and acceleration analysis; impact speed calculations using conservation of linear momentum. This course is recommended for a total of 4 semester hours in the lower-division baccalaureate/associate degree category.
1187f721-8b15-4e49-9994-a5bf55d87979.name: Advanced Traffic Crash Investigation - (Level II)(v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Virginia State Police Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, performance-based testing, and practical exercises with a minimum passing score of 75 percent.

The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, discussion, lecture, and practical exercises. The general course topics include review of fundamentals of crash investigation; general airborne equations; pedestrian crash investigation conservation of momentum both vector and algebraic solutions; time and distance equations and analysis.

1095724a-8e6b-4234-99ed-38dca0759ce5.description: The course objective is to prepare first line supervisors to comprehend and perform the necessary functions of a first line supervisor. This course is recommended for a total of 6 semester hours at the upper-division baccalaureate degree category.
1095724a-8e6b-4234-99ed-38dca0759ce5.name: Leadership and Professional Development: Sworn Officer(v.5)

issuer.summary: issued by Virginia State Police Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, performance-based testing, and practical exercises with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, classroom exercises, discussion, learner presentations, lecture, and practical exercises.

8bf0eb14-0db4-4afe-8dd8-1e94c53b2a57.description: The course builds upon IPTM's Advanced Traffic Crash Investigation by assisting the student in understanding vehicle dynamics. The student will study time/distance calculations, two-dimensional momentum and impact speed calculations using momentum equations. This program will teach derivation and origin of the commonly used speed formulas, speed of vehicles at impact using conservation of linear momentum, and behavior of vehicles in a collision using Newton's three laws of motion.
8bf0eb14-0db4-4afe-8dd8-1e94c53b2a57.name: Traffic Crash Reconstruction (Level III)(v.1)

issuer.summary: issued by Virginia State Police Academy

c8fb7c8c-fadd-49b9-8942-f42420913a3b.description: Advanced Crash Reconstruction builds upon the foundation of crash investigation knowledge gained in prerequisite courses to provide a further understanding of crash investigation and reconstruction techniques. Topics such as kinetic energy, impulse, and Delta V are expanded upon and the topics of conservation of momentum, time/distance, and airborne calculations are studied in more depth than in previous courses. In addition, students will be introduced to pedestrian crash investigation.
c8fb7c8c-fadd-49b9-8942-f42420913a3b.name: At-Scene Advanced Crash Investigation (Level I) (VSPA - 0012)(v.3)
